items.name: Component_Handler
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_FreeLayoutBehavior # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_Handler extends gs.Component ###* * The base class for all handler-components. A handler-component is * used to handle condition- or event-based processes of a In-Game UI * object like executing bindings or triggering actions. * * A handler is only executed if all assigned conditions and events are * true. * * @module ui * @class Component_Handler * @extends gs.Component * @memberof ui * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * @property mouseEntered * @type boolean * @protected ### @mouseEntered = no ###* * @property mouseLeaved * @type boolean * @protected ### @mouseLeaved = yes ###* * Checks if the condition is true for the specified game object. * * @method checkCondition * @param {gs.Object_Base} object The game object. * @param {Object} condition The condition-object. * @return {boolean} If true the condition is true. Otherwise false. * @static ### @checkCondition: (object, condition) -> result = no if condition.equalTo? result = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.field) == ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.equalTo) else if condition.greaterThan? result = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.field) > ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.greaterThan) else if condition.lessThan? result = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.field) < ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.lessThan) else if condition.notEqualTo? result = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.field) != ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(object, condition.notEqualTo) return result ###* * Checks if the specified condition is true. * * @method checkCondition * @param {Object} condition The condition-object. * @return {boolean} If true the condition is true. Otherwise false. ### checkCondition: (condition) -> ui.Component_Handler.checkCondition(@object, condition) ###* * Checks if the specified conditions are true. * * @method checkConditions * @param {Object[]} conditions An array of condition-objects. * @return {boolean} If true all conditions are true. Otherwise false. ### checkConditions: (conditions) -> result = yes for condition in conditions if not @checkCondition(condition) result = no break return result ###* * Checks if the specified event is true. * * @method checkEvent * @param {Object} event The event to check for. * @param {Object} [binding=null] binding An optional binding-object necessary for some event-types. * @return {boolean} If true the event is true. Otherwise false. ### checkEvent: (event, binding) -> result = no #if event == "onInitialize" and !SceneManager.scene.preparing # result = !@initializeEventEmitted # @initializeEventEmitted = yes if event == "onAlways" result = yes else if event == "onAction" result = @object.canReceiveInput() && Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.LEFT] == 2 and @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) else if event == "onCancel" result = @object.canReceiveInput() && Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.RIGHT] == 2 and @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) else if event == "onAccept" result = @object.canReceiveInput() && Input.release(Input.KEY_RETURN) or (Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.LEFT] == 2 and @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y)) else if event == "onDragEnter" entered = @object.canReceiveInput() && @object.dragDrop?.isDragging and @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) result = !@mouseEntered and entered @mouseEntered = entered else if event == "onDragLeave" leaved = @object.canReceiveInput() && @object.dragDrop?.isDragging and !@object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) result = !@mouseLeaved and leaved @mouseLeaved = leaved else if event == "onMouseEnter" entered = @object.canReceiveInput() && @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) result = !@mouseEntered and entered @mouseEntered = entered else if event == "onMouseLeave" leaved = @object.canReceiveInput() && !@object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) result = !@mouseLeaved and leaved @mouseLeaved = leaved else if event == "onMouseHover" result = @object.canReceiveInput() && @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) else if event == "onMouseClick" result = @object.canReceiveInput() && Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.LEFT] == 2 and @object.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) else if event.onChange? value = @resolveFieldPath(event.onChange) if value? value = value.get(@object) if binding[event.onChange] != value binding[event.onChange] = value result = yes else result = yes return result ###* * Checks if all events and conditions defined for the handler * are true. If that check returns true the handler must be * executed. * * @method checkObject * @param {Object} object The game object to check. * @return {boolean} If true the handler must be executed. Otherwise false. ### checkObject: (object) -> execute = yes if object.event? object.events = [object.event] delete object.event if object.condition? object.conditions = [object.condition] delete object.condition if object.events? for event in object.events execute = @checkEvent(event, object) if execute then break if object.conditions? and execute execute = @checkConditions(object.conditions) return execute ui.Component_Handler = Component_Handler
